column5: Hurry up already, your killing me   ...All I get is a few teasers from the other board... I want the Essay already , JESUS !! LOL

It's been a crazy day bro, lot's of stuff going on. On the way home yesterday my family was stopped at a red light and rammed from behind at 60km an hour. They're okay thank God, but were shaken... A lot of Bull today with the kids father, insurance, police etc., etc., etc....  Anyway I'll try and throw a report up tomorrow. It was a stellar trip  .
hope you and yours are all OK Mike, I would say thats a good enough excuse for the delay on the report, and there arent too many good excuses!  all the best   kemper
Solo good to know the family is ok. Cant wait to see the report always look forward to them.
Mike... get them all into a Doctor. Whiplash has a way of popping up a day or two later...and many times severe brusing/issues from the seatbelt when thrown forward.
I agree with Wayne. My wife suffered with it for many years afterward. She also didn't notice it right away.
Wow, good to hear you guys are ok  .... I hear you bud, there's nothin worse than dealing with accidents & insurance claims... Us steelhead folk can wait another day in suspense I guess

Already did that Wayne. Seemed the smart thing to do when Jo woke up this morning with a sore back and my daughter complained her neck hurt... My son's only 2 and not talking yet. In any case there appears to be no serious injuries but as you say you never know..
Take your yime,,i can imagine it is a very stressfull time for you,,,glad to hear everyone is ok!
Oh man...hope everyone is ok Mike!!!  Take care of them first...the report can wait.
good to hear every1 is okay....can't wait for the report!!!   Hawk

Glad to hear all is O.K.  The son got in the same mess a month ago.  Rear ended at the stop lightand was also lucky to avoid real injury, but the shoulder locked up 2 days later. The injuries can take up to 72 hours to show themselves.  Take care of your family first. Us yahoos can wait.  You'l probably spend 2 weeks playing games with the adjusters before all is settled.
Hope the family is alright Mike.  Best wishes!
I hope all is well with the family Mike. I really like reading your reports but family should always come first. I'll wait for your report and wishing your family an uncomplicated recovery.  Stan
yeah, soft tissue sets in 24-48 hours...i'd agree to send them to a doctor first....my buddy got t boned and 3 days later he locked up...  I'm glad everyone is okay.

Thank goodness your wife and beautiful children are alright! Puts things in perspective. Your a good and lucky man Mike.  Thanks for the great reports you have done, obviously the next one will have to wait. ehg
